title: Confusing `multiple matching crates` error caused by 2018 edition

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I tried to `use rand` when I hadn't added it to `Cargo.toml`.

```
error[E0464]: multiple matching crates for `rand`
 --> src\worker_utils\polling_worker_pool.rs:7:5
  |
7 | use rand::{self, Rng};
  |     ^^^^
  |
  = note: candidates:
          crate `rand`: \\?\C:\Users\diggs\.rustup\toolchains\nightly-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc\lib\rustlib\x86_64-pc-windows-msvc\lib\librand-8a8c92c0d9bc43b9.rlib
          crate `rand`: \\?\C:\Users\diggs\.rustup\toolchains\nightly-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc\lib\rustlib\x86_64-pc-windows-msvc\lib\librand-74b492d2b987a1e5.rlib

error[E0463]: can't find crate for `rand`
 --> src\worker_utils\polling_worker_pool.rs:7:5
  |
7 | use rand::{self, Rng};
  |     ^^^^ can't find crate
```

The first error is just misleading.
